content.raw:
hi @TwoBit01, which version of Ignition Transport are you using? If you're using > 2.0.0 Ignition-msgs should be already a dependency.

If you're using > 2.0.0, the `#include` for your message should be `#include <ignition/msgs/stringmsg.pb.h>` or `<ignition/msgs.hh>`. See the [example/](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/src/7d7777533017a0cb8912609e23ea5386d9fb1ff3/example/publisher.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) directory.

Could you elaborate which part of the documentation should we improve?
content.html:
hi @TwoBit01, which version of Ignition Transport are you using? If you're using > 2.0.0 Ignition-msgs should be already a dependency.

If you're using > 2.0.0, the #include for your message should be #include <ignition/msgs/stringmsg.pb.h> or <ignition/msgs.hh>. See the example/ directory.

Could you elaborate which part of the documentation should we improve?
